text:
Hey, sorry I missed this chat<@U25PYL3Q8>

I’ll try to curl request this
Good day everyone. I hope this is the right channel i can ask for assistance. I'm getting the following error, but I can't quite understand what it really means. Any help will be much appreciated.

What's everyone's solution/ workaround to marking API created contacts as Marketing?
 I'm not trying to wait a month because it's read only in APIs. Could I api submit a form with the prop hidden that could mark them?

Hey all :slightly_smiling_face:

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts>

Is there a way to use GET*`/crm/v3/objects/contacts/{contactId}`* with an email instead of the ID?

How can I fetch the contact with email as identifier?
Yes! One second I'll grab the docs
THX. Somehow I am blind to find it… Or I don’t understand the parts where email is mentioned.

Here's the first part: "Unique identifiers and deduplication
An email address is the <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/crm-setup/deduplication-of-contacts-companies-deals-tickets#automatic-deduplication-in-HubSpot|primary unique identifier >for a contact in HubSpot. For existing contacts, the contact ID is also unique and will deduplicate contacts. To update a contact via the API, you can use either the contact ID or the contact's email.
The `idProperty` query parameter doesn't appear on the _Endpoints_ tab due to technical limitations, but it can be used for contacts exclusively with `email`. To use an email address as the unique identifier, set the `idProperty` as `email` and enter the email address in place of the contact ID. This should be set as a query parameter rather than added to the request body."
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts>
yes, but how to do it?
<https://api.HubSpot.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts/{emailaddess}?idProperty=email>

Yes, but how to set the id property as email with PHP?

```$apiResponse = $client->crm()->contacts()->basicApi()->getById("contactId", null, null, null, false);```
I don’t see where to set the query
Ah with the PHP library one moment
I don't know how to do it with that endpoint in PHP but you can easily do it with the Batch read one POST*`/crm/v3/objects/contacts/batch/read`*
trying… mom
For that api call you need to add idProperty=email

```$BatchReadInputSimplePublicObjectId = new BatchReadInputSimplePublicObjectId(['properties' => ["email"], 'properties_with_history' => [null], 'id_property' => "email", 'inputs' => [{"id":"string"}]]);```
This crazy Json within the Array… :smile:

Is this a bug in documentation?
Honestly I think that's just how it is. That's one of the reason I don't use any of the SDKs
:smile:
thx. I made it working this way now.
<@U041UH3H7FG> I just learned about a new API endpoint by searching through github. <https://api.hubapi.com/contacts/v1/contact/email/{email}/profile>
This will return all the information for a specific contact
Apparently it's a legacy api <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/get_contact_by_email>
Hello, anyone getting errors with the owners api <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/owners>? I'm getting this error `TypeError: Cannot read property 'getById' of undefined`
I'm using Node

Thanks <@U03SQ56P40M> <@U25PYL3Q8>! I have missed the detail of this doc. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/private-apps> It doesn't support extensions. What I wanted to call was this api to upload the custom workflow extension. So I think I don't needed to change that. <https://api.hubapi.com/automationextensions/v1/definitions>
oof public app it is!
yes! correct. :+1: Thanks guys! much appreciated! :hand:
